documnet.title: The Discourses
documnet.paragraph1: He is free who lives as he wishes to live; who is neither subject to compulsion nor to hindrance, nor to force; whose movements to action are not impeded, whose desires anttain their purpose, and who does not fall into that which he would avoid.
documnet.paragraph: Do we then find any of the bad free from sorrow, free from fear, who does not fall into that which he would avoid, and does not abtain that which he wishe? Not one; nor then do we find any bad man free.
